compounddef.title: Start the cFE Core on the Target

detaileddescription.para: With everything loaded, the cFE can be started. Starting the cFE is a highly target dependant activity. The following table gives examples of how to start the cFE on various platforms. For full details see the notes for each section.

center.heading: How to start the cFE on Various Target Systems:

entry.para: Loaded through GDB/BDM using a shell script: "debug.sh"
Started from the vxWorks Target Shell command: startCfeCore "/eep:0/cfe-core.o"
Start directly from the linux shell: $ ./core-linux.bin PO 1 All of the command line options can be listed by typing: $./core-linux.bin -h
Start directly from the OS X shell: $ ./core-osx.bin PO 1 All of the command line options can be listed by typing: $./core-osx.bin -h
Start directly from the Cygwin shell: $ ./core-cygwin.exe PO 1 All of the command line options can be listed by typing: $./core-cygwin.exe -h

detaileddescription.para: Next: Target Specific Instructions Prev: Description of Fields in the Startup script Up To: Load and Run the cFE Core and cFE Applications
